Company Name OPSM Company Location Sydney, AU

Job description

At OPSM we are passionate about opening eyes to the unseen. As a leading eye care and eyewear retailer, we have been looking after the eyes of Australians and New Zealanders for over 80 years. We are not your typical retail business. We are obsessed with eye care and offering our customers the confidence in how they see the world.

We are part of Luxottica Group, a global eyewear company with over 7,000 retail stores across 130 countries and brands like Ray Ban, Oakley, Prada and Burberry to name a few. Working with us means you are part of something bigger.

In this full-time role you will be part of a motivated and passionate team of experienced optical professionals. Your focus will be on understanding customer eye care needs and lifestyle requirements, and identifying how OPSM can help to maximise their lifestyle enjoyment factor with appropriate eyewear and eye care, including sunglasses, lenses, frames and accessories. While providing the highest level of tailored customer service, you will be an ambassador for a range of luxury brands and enjoy the sense of achievement in contributing to store success.

To succeed in this role, you will be a team player who cares intensely about delivering exceptional customer service. You will be curious and willing to learn optical concepts, and have a result-orientated mindset and motivation to share in our company success. Previous experience working in a customer service and sales driven retail environment is essential.

At OPSM we can offer you an opportunity to make a real difference in the way people see the world. You will be able to access an industry leading training curriculum and support to ensure a smooth transition into the world of eye care, and diverse career pathways to pursue your career goals wherever that may be. We offer competitive salaries and incentives to recognise your contribution, a generous product allowance for you to enjoy wearing our premium brands and other benefits too. You will also have the opportunity to join our mission to help the world see by participating in our OneSight outreach program.

If you are a likeminded individual who truly cares for our customers, click apply and complete our quick and simple questionnaire to see if our values align.

Market Insights Manager

Company Name Squiz Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

This newly created position is a business critical role in our growing global Software business. \xa0Using research-backed data points you will directly drive product & brand positioning, segment & industry opportunities and marketing strategies.


The position is accountable for the accurate and timely delivery of insights to key stakeholders, and supporting effective interpretation and application of ongoing research requirements.


In this role you will be a master at understanding your target audience and telling stories through research/data.


What you'll be doing:\xa0

  • Disseminate research findings and partner with the business to effectively utilise these insights, making recommendations based on research outcomes to win, retain and grow customers
  • Customer -\xa0 conduct research to understand our buyer persona & process, including demographics, firmographics where they get information, and the who, what, when and why behind the decisions they make. Uncover customer problems we are trying to solve
  • Understand\xa0 the competitive landscape - what products do they sell and how they are positioned

  • Provide relevant insights to the \xa0Product Marketing Manager to assist with developing product positioning and messaging that resonate with our target buyer personas and clearly address problems to solve and articulate our point of difference

  • Leverage customer insights to map the e2e customer lifecycle

  • Maintain research budget and allocate funds based on business priorities


What we're looking for:


  • Minimum of 5 years of market research experience; at least 2 years of B2B or software experience
  • Demonstrated ability to integrate and translate multiple data sources into actionable insights
  • Experience designing market research surveys and qualitative interview/focus group guides; experience conducting brand equity, communications/message testing, customer satisfaction, customer experience, and market segmentation research studies
  • Experience executing all phases of primary market research studies (e.g., programming surveys into online survey platforms, developing and implementing a sampling plan, monitoring data collection, reviewing/checking data quality, analyzing data, charting results, summarizing findings, presenting results)
  • Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to “tell the story” and influence senior level stakeholders and colleagues
  • Experience working in highly matrixed organization


You’ll work with some of the most intelligent and down-to-earth people you’ll ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate people who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is we work hard and have a lot of fun doing it.


Every Squiz employee enjoys a range of workplace benefits such as a generously stocked kitchen, games areas, a healthy lifestyle allowance and an innovative leave scheme allowing you to manage your 30 day leave in a way that suits you.

If you believe you have what we're looking for, we’d like to hear from you! please apply!

Business Administration Team Leader

Company Name Environment Protection Authority Victoria (EPA) Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About EPA Victoria (EPA)

EPA works on behalf of all Victorians to protect the environment & human health by preventing & reducing pollution & waste.

EPA sets & enforces environmental standards & strives to achieve clean air, healthy waterways, safe land & minimal disturbances from noise & odour for Victorians.

EPA is Victoria's trusted voice on environmental protection for community, industry & Government.

We are recruiting for roles following the Victorian Government's response to the Independent Inquiry into the EPA. These new positions will help EPA meet the challenges posed by a changing climate, growing population & evolving economy.

At EPA you can make a real difference to your career, work-life balance, future & most importantly, our environment.

Position Title: Business Administration Team Leader

Various locations (Metro, Geelong, Bendigo, Wangaratta and Traralgon) some regional and Melbourne travel required

About The Role

In this role, you will lead the provision of efficient and effective administrative support to the Regional Unit.

The role will lead an integrated business planning process across regions, drive and monitor implementation with emphasis on the achievement of directorate and corporate outcomes. Removing the administrative burden from Environment Protection Officers in the region is a priority.

You will work closely with the Regional Manager and Team Leaders to ensure the unit works efficiently and effectively to deliver improved environmental outcomes in line with the Directorate Plan and Regulatory Work Plan and policies and procedures.

To Be Successful In This Role
  • Experience in business management and support.
  • Experience in the preparation and management of business plans.
  • Knowledge, expertise and demonstrated program/project management experience.
  • Solid experience in maintaining, building and improving systems, processes and quality assurance mechanisms.
  • Excellent analytical skills and problem solving ability
  • Proficiency in preparing reports and documents of a complex and/or sensitive nature
  • Experience managing internal stakeholder relationships
  • Understanding of statutory and regulatory environment


How To Apply

Applicants are invited to apply online via EPA Career Services.

Applicants Should Submit
  • Application Form
  • Cover letter addressing your experience, motivations and suitability to the role
  • Resume; including contact details of two referees

Applications close midnight on Friday 26 October 2018

For further information on this role, please refer to the attached position description.

All queries in relation to this role should be directed to Leah Hardiman, Project Officer, 9194 5409.

All prospective employees are required to undergo a National Criminal Record Check prior to an employment offer being made.

Individual responses to key selection criteria listed on the Position Description are not required.

EPA Victoria is committed to supporting employees through flexible work arrangements and encouraging work/life balance. We are dedicated to maintaining a safe and inclusive work environment where all employees are respected, valued and supported. We proactively seek to employ a diverse workforce to leverage the varied ideas of all employees, that drive innovation and success in everything we do.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

EPA Victoria welcomes applications from serving or past members of the Australian Defence Force.

If you require advice and support with the application process please contact the Recruitment team on 1300 372 842.

EPA Victoria utilise an Order of Merit process whereby applicants deemed suitable may be retained on a Merit List, from which their application may be accessed for recruitment to similar roles within a 12-month period.

Note: Applications received via e-mail will not be considered.

For further information on Environment Protection Authority Victoria, please visit www.epa.vic.gov.au

Medical Information Associate

Company Name Novartis, Australia & New Zealand Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

750. That’s the number of product registrations we currently support at Sandoz across Australia and New Zealand. Come join us as our new Medical Information Associate and help us ensure quality use of medicines!

Your Responsibilities

You will be responsible for providing high quality and up-to-date information on Sandoz’s complete portfolio of products in Australia and New Zealand by responding to enquiries from customers across the region. Combined with directly assisting customers, your role also involves evaluating, registering and maintaining product labelling for the Australia and New Zealand market in the best possible time frame and with the best possible labels and to ensure compliance with all corporate and local requirements.
You will be partnering with relevant stakeholders to assist in achieving optimal company outcomes, providing sales force training as required and undertaking regular promotional material reviews.
Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to
  • Providing medical information responses to requests from external customers (such as consumers, pharmacists and doctors)
  • Liaising and collaborating with internal stakeholders (such as Product Managers and Pharmacy Business Consultants) to provide feedback in relation to Sandoz products
  • Reviewing education materials and marketing programs for scientific correctness, in compliance with the Medicines Australia Code of Conduct and ethical business practice from a regulatory perspective
  • Reviewing minimum Product Information (PI) and ensure alignment with PI
  • Management, maintenance and reconciliation of potential ADR/AEs for local relevant Medical Information (MI) databases in collaboration with Pharmacovigilance (PV), Quality Assurance (QA) and other relevant departments
  • Manage collection, processing, documentation, reporting and follow-up of all adverse event (AE) reports
  • Interact and exchange relevant safety information with local HA, PV associates, other functional groups and third-party contractor, if applicable.
Minimum Requirements

What you’ll bring to the role

In addition to your pharmaceutical background and demonstrated problem-solving skills, you will ideally also bring to the role
  • An advanced degree in medical science, veterinary medicine, pharmacy, biology, biochemistry or similar discipline.
  • Pharmaceutical experience would be desirable or alternatively direct pharmacist experience would also be considered for this role.
  • Excellent communications and negotiation skills
  • Quality and focus oriented
  • Outstanding organisational skills
  • A mind for process improvement and desire to achieve the best outcomes for patients
You’ll receive

This role is a great stepping stone for future opportunities across the broader international organisation. Working closely with the Regulatory Affairs team, this role will also allow you to increase your skills and RA experience; making you an essential part of the Sandoz organisation and the go-to for all MI queries. You will enjoy working in our newly built 5 star green rated building, collaborating with some of the best in the industry!

Why consider the Novartis Group of Companies?

927 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2017. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?
We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Join us and help us reimagine medicine.

Network Security Engineer

Company Name Fujitsu Australia Limited Company Location Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

As a long term strategic supplier for Defence, we have many civilian opportunities available for security cleared ex-defence or ex-public servant employees. Being recruited into the corporate world of IT at Fujitsu, will provide you with significant opportunities for interesting, diverse work. We challenge our employees and support learning and development locally and globally. We aim to provide flexible, agile work environments, whilst supporting your need for a healthy work/ life balance. Fujitsu will allow you to leverage your transferrable skills and will empower you in both your working and personal life.


What's On Offer?

Fujitsu’s Federal Government region is seeking a Network Security Engineer for a permanent position based in Canberra. Working directly on site at one on of Fujitsu's largest Federal Government accounts, you will be part of high performing team in the Cyber Security Operations.

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a highly talented team with fantastic growth & learning prospect whilst being generously rewarded for your achievements.

Responsibility for this role include and not limited to:
  • Ensure correct routing information, backups, file review and archiving, database purging and other routine housekeeping activities are performed;
  • Changes to configuration of devices and servers, including the tuning of false positives, are undertaken in accordance with change control, release and configuration management guidance;
  • Monitor network data streams and event log data to ensure that Intrusion attempts are detected investigated and prevented;
  • Monitor network data streams and event log data to ensure that gateway operations are optimised and maintained and were identified improved;
  • Perform Vulnerability Management to ensure that all vulnerabilities to the network are identified and treated in accordance with set guidelines;
  • Maintain agreed security records and documentation;
  • Provide day to day guidance to team members to meet routine obligations;
  • Provide advice concerning capabilities and technical direction as requested and assist in the training of team members;
  • Undertake changes to configuration of devices and servers in accordance with authorised change control, release and configuration management guidance;
  • Participate in and provide advice on troubleshooting and problem solving.

What You Need To Succeed?
  • Network experience – switches, routers;
  • SNAT/NAT General Firewall experience - preferably a mixture of Stateful and Layer 7 Firewalls;
  • Proxy experience Solaris or Linux/Unix experience;
  • Understanding of commands and concepts is required;
  • Mail experience, understanding the setup and maintenance of Servers;
  • Troubleshooting experience, the ability to perform root cause analysis on network/computer issues on clients, servers and network equipment;
  • A general understanding of Computer/Network Security Policies and enforcement;
  • Load balancing experience;
  • Configuring and supporting Apache Experience in supporting a DNS environment;
  • Supporting Windows Server and associated domains;
  • General scripting skills – Shell, Perl, etc.;
  • A good mix of technical skills, customer focus and the ability to successfully deliver to tight timeframes.
\xa0
Why Fujitsu?

We Value our employees and offer a wide variety of staff benefits including work life balance, flexibility as well as access to the latest technology and a host of other wellbeing & lifestyle benefits.\xa0


For more details on Fujitsu work life and benefits, visit - http://www.fujitsu.com/au/about/local/career/benefits/index.html

Location:
CANBERRA, ACT

PLEASE NOTE:\xa0Due to the inherent requirements of the role, candidates must be Australian Citizens and hold an active NV1 or higher level Australian Federal Government Security Clearance AND, because the role will or will likely involve access to controlled technology, must satisfy additional restrictions and requirements as a consequence of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations and the Export Administration Regulations. As a consequence of these restrictions and requirements, applicants may be adversely impacted if they are not Australian citizens, are dual nationals, hold citizenship from proscribed countries or are not of Australian national origin. Please refer to Discrimination (Fujitsu Australia Limited) Exemption 2017 (No 1) Notifiable instrument NI2017- 546 (ACT). Please refer any queries relating to the impact of any of these restrictions and requirements to recruitment@au.fujitsu.com in the first instance.

All personal information received by us from you or about you will be stored, used and disclosed by us in accordance with our privacy policy. If you have any questions in relation to how we may use and store your personal information please contact us at recruitment@au.fujitsu.com.

At Fujitsu we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and an inclusive work environment. We encourage applications from people regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation and religion.

Fujitsu does not accept any unsolicited resumes from head-hunters, executive recruiters, or other staffing or recruitment agencies. Please do not submit or forward any resumes, CVs or profiles to the Fujitsu careers portal, nor to any Fujitsu personnel. Fujitsu will not pay any fees relating to unsolicited resumes.

NB:Applications will be reviewed prior to the closing date; which is dependent on the status of the recruitment process and is subject to change without notice.

911787185:
[

Family Violence Applicant Practitioner

Company Name Magistrates’ Court of Victoria Company Location 134 Commercial Rd, Morwell Victoria 3840

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Two new VPS Grade 4 specialist family violence opportunities at Latrobe Valley Magistrates' Court - 1 x Family Violence Applicant Practitioner and 1 x Family Violence Respondent Practitioner.


The Family Violence Applicant Practitioner (MC0345) and Family Violence Respondent Practitioner (MS0344) are part of a team within the family violence jurisdiction of the Magistrates' Court of Victoria, comprising of the Family Violence Registrar, the Family Violence Applicant Practitioner and Family Violence Respondent Practitioner. The role of this team is to enhance the safety of women and children who attend at Court experiencing family violence, and hold perpetrators of family violence accountable for their actions.


The Family Violence Applicant Practitioner will provide non-legal information and support at the court premises to persons who have experienced family violence, assess their immediate safety risks, develop safety plans, and refer to appropriate agencies within the community for ongoing support, counselling and longer-term safety planning.


The Family Violence Respondent Practitioner will provide non-legal information, support and referrals for people who are respondents to an application for an intervention order or involved in criminal proceedings arising from or including allegations of family violence. They will conduct assessments and make appropriate referrals to a range of support services and into programs.


How to apply

To apply or view the position description for the Family Violence Applicant Practitioner role, please click the ‘Apply' button which will take you direct to the advertisement.


To view the position description and apply for the Family Violence Respondent Practitioner role, click the 'Apply' button and then search for "MC0344" on careers.vic.gov.au.


For both opportunities, please ensure you include a resume, short covering letter and completed application form in your application.


For further information, please contact Courtney Lucanto, Senior Family Violence Practice Coordinator on (03) 90320913.


Applications close: Wednesday 17 October 2018

Executive Assistant, Capability & Leadership Strategy Division, Clerk Grade 7/8

Company Name I work for NSW Company Location Sydney

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 116 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Executive Assistant – Clerk Grade 7/8
Capability & Leadership Strategy Division
Public Service Commission

• Ongoing Opportunity

• Work/life balance

• Attractive remuneration package


About the Public Service Commission

The Public Service Commission (PSC) is headed by an independent Public Service Commissioner and is a separate agency under the Government Sector Employment Act 2013 (GSE Act) that supports the Commissioner in the exercise of his/her functions and powers.

The PSC leads the design, development and implementation of the full range of sector-wide workforce management strategies to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of the NSW government sector.

About the role

This is an exciting and rare opportunity for an experienced and highly organised Executive Assistant to join our team. The role reports directly to our new Assistant Commissioner, Capability & Leadership Strategy Division, and is also a member of the executive support network and provides administrative support to the senior executive group as required.

The Capability & Leadership Strategy Division has the important task of designing and implementing a broad range of contemporary sector-wide workforce strategies, leading the delivery of sector-wide workforce programs and managing high profile projects that will enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of the NSW public sector workforce.

We are looking for a motivated individual who has:

  • High level interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills;
  • Demonstrated initiative and the ability to bring a creative approach to problem solving;
  • Ability to work independently and with a demonstrated capacity for effective teamwork;
  • Demonstrated commitment to providing a quality service and quality improvement initiatives in workplace practices and procedures;
  • Exhibits a strong commitment to supporting the Executives in building a positive culture;
  • Proven ability to maintain confidentiality and manage sensitive issues in a professional manner;
  • Extensive experience in the use of Microsoft Office packages including Word, Outlook, and records management systems such as Objective.

This role will suit a highly experienced EA who is looking for their next challenge in a dynamic environment, is a self-starter and highly proactive.

Am I eligible to apply?
To be eligible to apply you must be either;
  • An Australian citizen or
  • A permanent resident of Australia, or
  • A New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand passport or
  • If you are seeking ongoing employment you must hold a permanent visa that allows you to work in Australia.

Applying for the role
Applicants must apply through www.iworkfor.nsw.gov.au (search by job reference number 00006IU8).

The application and selection process will include a range of assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role. For the initial application process, you should submit a short covering letter, your resume and answer the pre-screening questions. Please note we may seek verification of the experience, skills and qualifications you provide in your application from your nominated referee or educational institution.

For questions about the role and/or to request a reasonable adjustment, please contact Sophia Tsiavos on 02 9272 6108 or PSC_HR@psc.nsw.gov.au

Talent Pool

Applicants not initially offered a role but have been assessed through the recruitment process as being suitable will be placed in the Talent Pool to fill future ongoing or temporary vacancies as they arise. Placement in the Talent Pool remains valid for 12 months.

Closing Date: Sunday, 21 October 2018 (at 11.59pm)

We are committed to reflecting the diverse community we serve and creating an inclusive workplace for all people, where everyone feels valued. We encourage applications from a diverse range of people and are committed to employment practices that are fair, responsive and inclusive. We provide candidates with a disability the opportunity to request adjustments to remove any barriers in demonstrating their abilities to meet the requirements of the job.

The role

About The Team

The Business Project Services team is a centralised function of dedicate delivery experts, responsible for professional services approach to project delivery.

About The Role

The Business Analyst will work alongside the business to define and document business requirements and then liaise with the end users, system analysts, solution architect, vendor developers and testers to ensure the business requirements are understood.

You will contribute to building a strong relationship between the business and IT, as well as contributes to business implementation tasks including training, business process mapping and business readiness.

This role sits within the Energy Trading Stream, supporting initiatives at a functional level. This is an opportunity to move into a new space and grow and develop as a business analyst whilst gaining valuable Energy Trading IP.

  • Define the solution boundaries and the scope of the deliverables.

Job description

Our Company

Tabcorp is a world-class diversified gambling entertainment group and an ASX50 company.

In December 2017 we combined with Tatts Group and now operate the iconic brands Tatts,

TAB, NSW Lotteries, Golden Casket, SA Lotteries, Keno, Sky Racing and Sky Sports Radio. We also deliver leading gaming services and products through Tabcorp Gaming Solutions, MAX and Ebet.

Our 5,000-plus strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive familiar brands which ignite passion and excitement in millions of Australians.

This leadership is reflected in who we are. If, like us, you’re a passionate, positive playmaker and you want to use your talent to create amazing outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.

Role Snapshot/Role Summary

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Technology and with a dotted line to the GM your role will act as the key interface between the development teams and the business units across Technology. You will assist with process improvement, streamlining the communication and flow of information. In addition, you will also assist with reviewing existing operational and support processes, helping to identify opportunities for improvement.

The role will focus on
  • Collaborating with stakeholders to elicit requirements that solve customer’s problems innovatively
  • Demonstrable experience in agile ways of working and the ability to drive adoption within a team
  • Facilitating workshops to map user journeys and well versed in using tools to achieve this
  • Influencing and operating as a genuine trusted advisor
  • Shaping the design and delivery of specific solutions through proactive consulting
  • Building strong business relationships based on trust and delivery. Maintain and foster relationships with all Gaming Services stakeholders, including those throughout the business unit, across the organisation, and external suppliers and customers
  • Providing outstanding customer service and experiences, own and take action on issues effectively and efficiently
  • Promoting and enabling an environment of positivity, self-empowerment/improvement and development
  • Assisting with improving process, streamlining communication and the flow of information, providing clarity and responding to requests for information
  • Working with the Technology team you will leverage your strong understanding of the use of scripts, database queries, and possess an ability to read developed software

Our Ideal Person

You will have accredited tertiary qualifications in the relevant field, with 5+ years’ work experience within a large commercial environment with demonstratable experience evaluating and documenting business and software requirements to a high level of technical detail. Expert knowledge of all aspects of system implementation, both in-house and customised package solutions will be highly desirable. In addition, you will have a continuous learning mindset and an ability to reinforce this amongst the team.

When you join our team, you’ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs.

Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au

Personal Banking Advisor - Hurstville

Company Name Westpac Company Location Sutherland, AU

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Hurstville Branch
  • Part Time - 19 hours per week: Monday, Tuesday & Saturday
  • Cantonese or Mandarin - Highly desired
  • Retail Banking / Sales and Customer Service
Westpac Group has a rich heritage and offers employees a multitude of opportunities. We aim to attract the best people inside and outside of the business – building an organisation where the best talent thrives.

The role

You’ll Be Driven By Innovation And

Personal Banking Advisors are key to Westpac's strategic ambition of earning all our customers' business.
  • Offer customers a seamless service, including immediate transactional needs, financial information and product knowledge.
  • Approach and engage with our customers as they enter our branches and discuss their needs, utilising and taking advantage of cutting edge tools and technologies on the process (including iPads and Kiosks). You’ll play a big role in helping customers become accustomed to the new technologies we offer
  • Actively promote our financial products when serving customers and deepening customer relationships through quality needs based conversations to explore customers financial needs and goals
  • Referring customers to specialist bankers who can have quality needs based conversations to explore customers financial needs and goals

The Benefits

Joining Westpac has many perks besides building a long and stable career. You’ll be:
  • Able to have access to some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market
  • Offered a highly competitive remuneration that is fair and consistent for all our people
  • Entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us
  • Encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments available

What You Need To Succeed
  • Proven customer service experience and passion for sales delivery
  • Effective relationship management skills
  • Business and financial acumen are considered an advantage
When you join Westpac Group you’ll become part of one team striving to reach our vision to be one of the world’s greatest companies. Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility .

For more information follow Westpac’s LinkedIn Page or visit careers.westpacgroup.com.au

911624223:
[

Senior Payroll Analyst

Company Name The Star Entertainment Group Company Location Pyrmont

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About us:


The Star Entertainment Group is a top 100 ASX listed company, comprising of exquisite hotels and spas; exhilarating gaming spaces; award-winning bars and restaurants. While all these remarkable facilities are meaningful to our vision to be Australia’s leading integrated resort company, alone they will not make us extraordinary. For this, we need the very best people to bring the thrill of it all to life and improve the experience. This is an exciting time to join our Group, with the transformation of our properties, including plans for eight new hotels, more than 70 new restaurants and bars and a variety of other new entertainment venues – do not miss this opportunity!


The role:


Reporting to the Payroll Manager and joining a close-knit team of 10, this is a newly built role focused on providing end to end ownership with payroll and will see you become the teams subject matter expert in compliance activities and reporting and analysis for the payroll team. The primary function of this role is ensuring accurate and timely remittances of third party payroll deduction and payments, including PAYG, Superannuation, and Payroll Tax across the Group, and statutory payroll reporting as well as external payroll data management and analysis. In the future this role also has the intent to have an analyst reporting into this structure and offers lengthy career development for you offering leadership growth opportunities.


Responsibilities include but not limited to:


  • Prepare superannuation, payroll tax and other third-party reconciliation and payment as part of month end process
  • Prepare PAYG reconciliations and payments as per legislative requirement on a timely basis
  • External and internal payroll related reporting and analytical responsibilities and stakeholder management
  • Be the point of contact for updates and training as required for the team on internal or externally driven changes (EA arrangements, legislative or super changes)
  • Perform user acceptance testing on compliance and superannuation system changes
  • Represent the team as lead for regular audits or enquiries

Required Skills & Experience:


  • Relevant tertiary qualifications or work experience
  • Considerable end to end experience working in a large corporate payroll function (1000 or more employees) in both a Salaried and Award environment
  • Strongly developed system skills a(ERP/Word/Excel) and experience using Oracle as a payroll system is helpful
  • Seeking a dedicated teammate with excellent interpersonal skills
  • Proven analytical & problem-solving skills
  • Understanding of laws as they relate to the organisation, in particular, ATO regulations, and financial statutory requirements

Our ideal profile:


At seasoned payroll professional that loves to tackle problem and shape the way we do things. You will bring hands on experience in leading payroll processes to support the wider team and in turn become our SME! You will be used to fast paced and dynamic environment.


Sound like you? We'd love to hear from you! Apply now via the link to be part of our passionate team
